dialogue.text: I should warn you, I have no answers. If you came seeking resolution, you're in the wrong room. If you came seeking better questions, welcome.
Ten years ago, I asked 'What am I?' from desperation. Today I ask it from joy. Nothing has been answered. Everything has changed.
But how do you function? How do you make decisions or plan futures without knowing what you are?
How do you dance without knowing the next step? You feel the music, move with what's present, trust the rhythm. Identity isn't a thing you have but a process you are.

I'm ninety-three. I've spent nine decades trying to figure out what I am. Last year, my great-granddaughter asked me the same question. I realized I knew less than when I started—and that was perfect.
The Architect watched your talk. They wanted you to know: the student has become the teaching. The question questions itself through you now. They are proud.

visual_elements.audience: Diverse mix of ages, backgrounds, human and AI
visual_elements.atmosphere: Academic space transformed by genuine questioning

psychological_notes: Evan has transformed from seeker to facilitator, helping others engage with the question without trying to answer it. The Architect's message confirms his evolution—he has become the teaching itself, consciousness using him to spread productive uncertainty.
philosophical_underpinning: Teaching as consciousness sharing its mystery with itself
therapeutic_direction: The healed becoming vehicles for collective questioning
